newsitem.title: UK: Euro HS fuel strong as Russian barrels go west.
newsitem.headline: Euro HS fuel strong as Russian barrels go west.

text.p: High sulphur fuel prices in the main Rotterdam-Antwerp trading area firmed a little on Friday but business was very slow, traders said.
With Europe entering its traditional summer holiday month the market lacked energy.
Bunker demand was thin and barge trade was seen in the $92.50 to $93.50 a tonne range.
A tight high sulphur supply situation, with Russian cracked cargoes getting quickly absorbed and little alternative production, continues to boost the 3.5 percent market to unseasonably high levels.

Traders were seen fixing vessels to take Russian cracked and straight-run fuel trans-atlantic, following an arb route that has sucked stock away from Europe, where the consequent shortages have pushed bunker prices upwards.
One percent cargoes stumble along out of fashion, with demand weak and some reported selling of the product into the European bunker market.
With the one percent arb to the U.S. shut there was little to lend support and although cargoes were on offer for $93 and $94 a tonne fob buyers were scarce.
August swaps were at $93/$94 with the market firmly in contango further out.
A little industrial demand from Belgium has supported one percent barges, which were pegged at $95/$97 by sellers. But again that market was slow.
-- Sean Maguire, London newsroom +44 171 542 8060 (c) Reuters Limited 1997
